intro: Turritis falcata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf turritis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and striking purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showing a preference for well-drained soils. It blooms in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of bell-shaped flowers. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
